intro: Machaerium compressicaule var. manaoense, commonly known as the Manaoense Machaerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, compressed stem and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as understorey forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation projects.
